overview_of_class: The course concentrates on the analysis of data obtained from experiments in the behavioral sciences, especially psychology. Major emphasis is placed on analysis of variance techniques going from simple single-factor independent group designs to multiple-factor designs involving both between- and within- subject manipulations. General rules are stressed.
name: Statistics in Experimental Design
title: WCAS PSYCH 451-1-20 Statistics in Experimental Design

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course concentrates on the analysis of data obtained from experiments in the behavioral sciences, especially psychology. Major emphasis is placed on analysis of variance techniques going from simple single-factor independent group designs to multiple-factor designs involving both between- and within- subject manipulations. General rules are stressed.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: P/N is not allowed. Students must have had a single undergraduate course in statistics (taken in any department). Furthermore students should have had a course on experimentation in behavioral science (such as Experimental Psychology) or some experience in experimentation.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture, discussion, readings from original source articles as well as from the text.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Homework problem sets, a midterm, and a final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: "Design and Analysis: A Researcher's Handbook" by Keppel

subject: PSYCH
